title: Product Owner
description:
Product Owner - Customer Engagement/ Software Development (6-Month Contract)Location: SpainSalary: $350+ per dayAre you a highly skilled Product Owner with a proven track record in the field and a passion for customer engagement and software development? Do you have extensive experience with agile methodologies, particularly Scrum, and the proficiency to navigate project management tools like Jira? Are you familiar with Sprinklr and PowerBi, and do you have a deep understanding of the insurance industry? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!You will play a critical role in shaping and delivering innovative solutions that drive customer engagement and success. This is a 6-month initial contract position with the potential for extension, offering competitive daily compensation of $350+.Product Ownership: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, prioritize, and manage the product backlog. Take ownership of the product vision, ensuring alignment with customer engagement and software development goals.Agile Expertise: Apply agile methodologies, particularly Scrum, to drive product development. Lead sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and sprint reviews to ensure efficient project delivery.Project Management: Utilize project management tools like Jira to track progress, manage tasks, and facilitate communication among team members.Data Insights: Leverage your knowledge of PowerBi to analyze data, gain valuable insights, and make data-driven decisions to improve the product.Industry Expertise: Apply your deep understanding of the insurance industry to tailor products and solutions to specific customer needs and industry requirements.Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with various stakeholders, including developers, designers, and business analysts, to ensure clear communication and alignment on project objectives.A minimum of 5 years of experience as a Product Owner or in a similar role within the customer engagement or software development industry.Proficiency in agile development methodologies, specifically Scrum.Demonstrated experience with project management tools, such as Jira.Familiarity with Sprinklr and PowerBi is highly preferred.In-depth knowledge of the insurance industry.Strong communication, problem-solving, and leadership skills.Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.Proven track record of delivering successful product outcomes.If you are a results-driven Product Owner with the skills and experience we are looking for, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in shaping the future of customer engagement in the insurance industry

description:

team.Responsibilities:Lead and inspire a team of software engineers, architects, and technical specialists, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.Drive title: Data Engineer
description:
INCREDIBLE CAREER OPPORTUNITY AT ONE OF THE WORLD'S LARGEST INSURANCE ORGANISATIONS WORKING IN THEIR INVESTMENT ACCOUNTING AND ADMINISTRATION DEPARTMENT WITHIN INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT FOR AN EXPERIENCED DATA ENGINEER IN CLOUD-BASED DATABASE DESIGN AND ARCHITECTURE, DATA PIPELINES, PYTHON, SPARK, AND DELTA/DATA LAKE TECHNOLOGY.Those in this position will play a crucial role in designing, developing, improving, and maintaining a sophisticated data hub responsible for overseeing critical business operations. Successful candidates should showcase a strong ability to grasp new concepts rapidly, possess a background in data engineering, and/or demonstrate solid expertise in software engineering.Responsibilities Work with the team to understand platform capabilities and how to best improve and expand those capabilities.Design, development, enhancement, and maintenance of complex data pipeline products which manage business-critical operations and large-scale analytics applications.Support internal Investment Management clients and understand their unique needs and challenges.Instil excellence into the processes, methodologies, standards, and technology choices embraced by the team.Embrace new concepts quickly to keep up with fast-moving data engineering technology.Dedicate time to continuous learning to keep the team appraised of the latest developments in the space.Qualifications3+ years of Data Engineering experience including 2+ years designing and building Databricks data pipelines is required; Azure cloud is highly preferred, however will consider AWS, GCP or other cloud platform experience in lieu.Experience with conceptual, logical and/or physical database designs is a plus2+ years of hands-on Python/Pyspark/SparkSQL and/or Scala experience is required2+ years of experience with Big Data pipelines or DAG Tools (Data Factory, Airflow, dbt, or similar) is required2+ years of Spark experience (especially Databricks Spark and Delta Lake) is required2+ years of hands-on experience implementing Big Data solutions in a cloud ecosystem, including Data/Delta Lakes, is required2+ years of SQL experience, specifically to write complex, highly optimized queries across large volumes of data is highly desiredExperience of R would be a plusExperience with financial data providers such as Bloomberg in an asset management firm or other financial service company is highly desiredMust be comfortable speaking English Perks of the job‚Ç¨400/dayFully Remote!!English Speaking6-12 Month Contract5 Year Project!!Clear path of progression and growth!Expert level team matesAmazing culturePlease contact me on miles.girling@exploreltd.com asap to discuss more!!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Role: Senior Data Platform EngineerLocation: LondonJob DescriptionWe're searching for a Data Platform Engineer to head up the data engineering and algorithm development in our clients top sports performance platform. In this position, you'll be in charge of a team of skilled data engineers who build data pipelines to support a large user base. Your job involves creating and implementing machine learning and big data algorithms using the latest serverless technology. We're looking for someone with leadership experience and a strong educational background.The ideal candidate is a hands-on leader who can guide diverse teams in a high-performance work setting. You'll closely collaborate with their Data Science, Product, and Design teams, serving as a bridge between engineering and cross-functional leadership.Key Responsibilities:Take full responsibility for data operations engineering and execution.Provide hands-on guidance and technical leadership to your team, including:Deploying machine learning algorithms in their Python-based data pipelines.Working with data scientists to put their models into action.Creating data models, validation tests, and database queries to support data integration and app development.Managing tasks from technical design to technical client support.Manage expectations with their internal teams and adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment that relies heavily on AWS.Requirements:Proficiency in Python 3Familiarity with Python libraries for data, like Pandas and NumpyExperience with AWSKnowledge of different database types, including NoSQL databasesSkills in improving performanceProven experience delivering complex softwareFamiliarity with CI/CD tools, such as Gitlab, Github, Jenkins, Circle, etc.Experience with serverless deploymentsExposure to data science frameworks like MatLab and SageMakerCollaborative and mentoring abilitiesReach out to me: reuben.adebambo@exploreltd.com

title: Graph Database Engineer
description:

title: Azure Logic Apps Specialist
description:

title: Golang Developer
description:
We are currently seeking a skilled Golang Developer to join our team on a contract basis. This exciting opportunity allows you to work fully remote, contributing your expertise to meaningful projects.Position Overview:As a Golang Developer, you will play a pivotal role in our software development process. We are looking for an experienced individual with a strong command of Golang, capable of delivering high-quality solutions within a remote work setting.Responsibilities:Develop scalable and efficient software solutions using Golang.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and understand project requirements.Write clean, maintainable code following industry best practices.Conduct thorough code reviews and provide constructive feedback.Debug and optimize code for performance and scalability.Qualifications:Proven experience as a Golang Developer.Strong proficiency in Golang and relevant frameworks.Experience with microservices architecture.Familiarity with containerization tools such as Docker.Solid understanding of software development best practices.Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).Previous experience working in remote environments.Immediate availability to start the contract.Strong portfolio or examples of past Golang projects.

title: Scala Developer
description:
Scala Developer-Fully Remote-¬£50k to ¬£70k DOEMy client are revolutionising the music tech industry and are currently looking for a Scala Developer to join their expanding team at a key point in the journey of scaling up.Responsibilities:- Design, develop, and maintain scalable and high-performance backend systems using Scala.- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.- Implement best practices in software development, ensuring code quality, and participating in code reviews.- Work closely with product managers, architects, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into robust, scalable, and maintainable solutions.Requirements:- At least 4+ years experience as a Scala Developer or in a similar role.- Strong proficiency in Scala and functional programming principles.- Experience with Akka, Play Framework, and other Scala frameworks.- Solid understanding of distributed systems and microservices architecture.- Familiarity with relational and NoSQL databases.- Experience with build tools such as SBT.Benefits:- Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.- Flexible work hours and remote work options.- Professional development opportunities.- Collaborative and innovative work environment.If you're passionate about Scala development and want to be part of a forward-thinking team, we'd love to hear from you!Although this role is Fully Remote you must be based in the UK and their is no sponsorship offered for this roleApply for the role or alternative send your CV to simon.miles@exploreltd.com

title: Senior Scala Engineer
description:
Are you a seasoned Senior Scala Engineer looking for your next exciting contract opportunity? We are seeking a highly skilled individual to join our team and contribute to cutting-edge projects.Role and Responsibilities:As a Senior Scala Engineer, you will:Develop and maintain high-quality, scalable, and efficient software solutions using Scala.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement complex features and systems.Participate in code reviews, mentor junior developers, and ensure adherence to best coding practices.Identify and address performance bottlenecks, technical debt, and architectural improvements.Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, ensuring system stability and reliability.Qualifications:Proven track record as a Senior Scala Engineer, demonstrating expertise in functional programming.Strong proficiency in Scala, Akka, Play, and related technologies.Experience with microservices architecture, containerization (e.g., Docker), and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).Proficiency in database systems (SQL and NoSQL) and data modelling.Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset.Contact Details:Contract Duration: Flexible (Specify contract duration)Rate: ¬£450 - ¬£550 per day (Outside IR35)Location: RemoteStart Date: Immediate
